alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 6:33PM MST until January 12 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 16 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Wind chills Friday morning will drop to 20-40 degrees below zero. The combination of snow, wind, and wind chills make this a dangerous situation for people and animals. * WHERE...Lolo Pass, Highway 93 Sula to Lost Trail Pass, Highway 83 Seeley Lake to Condon, Highway 200 Bonner to Greenough, and I-90 East Missoula to Bearmouth. * WHEN...From 5 AM Thursday to 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
